meanings.definition: Attracting attention or interest in a memorable way.
meanings.sent1: The catchy song was the catchiest tune at the party.
meanings.sent2: That jingle is the catchiest one I've ever heard.
meanings.sent3: The catchy commercial made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was the catchiest sound in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the advertisement made it the catchiest one on the billboard.

meanings.definition: Having a melody or phrase that is easily remembered.
meanings.sent1: The catchiest part of the song was the chorus.
meanings.sent2: This tune is the catchiest one on the radio right now.
meanings.sent3: The catchy jingle stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was the catchiest melody in the entire concert.
meanings.sent5: The catchy beat made everyone dance along.

meanings.definition: Tending to be caught or trapped easily.
meanings.sent1: The catchiest fish in the pond was the biggest one.
meanings.sent2: The spider's web was the catchiest trap for insects.
meanings.sent3: The sticky tape was the catchiest way to catch bugs.
meanings.sent4: The spider's web was the catchiest snare for unsuspecting flies.
meanings.sent5: The catchiest net in the ocean caught the most fish.
